_header: Lord say me for the maiden love that thou thy mother calls
Title(s): ‘þe vision of sire William Banestre, knyght’
_description: ‘þe vision of sire William Banestre, knyght’ — 118 lines

BodHat56.First Lines:
Lord sey me for þe mayden love that thou þi modir
                    callesWhat shall worthe of our kyng lord yf it be þi
                    wylle…
BodHat56.Last Lines:
…he shal poysened man be as he at þe bord sittes&
                    with thre kynges of Coleyn cast in þe Middis
BodHat56.Attributed Title:
þare of þe vision of sire william Banastre knyght (f.
                    37b)
BodHat56.Editions:
Weiskott,  Eric. 
             “Alliterative Meter after 1450:  The Vision of William Banastre.” 
             Early English Poetic Culture and Metre: The Influence of G. R. Russom.
         Ed. Lindy Brady and M. J. Toswell. Kalamazoo, MI: Medieval Institute. 149-79: 155-9 (critical edition).

BodRawC813.First Lines: lord tell me for thi medenes love þat þou thi mother callythewhat shall beworth of our king lord iff it be thi will…
BodRawC813.Last Lines: …he shall poysoned man be at he at boord sitteswith þe iii kynges of colayne be cast in þe middes
BodRawC813.Attributed Title: Pars visionis domini William Banistre milytis
BodRawC813.Editions:
Weiskott,  Eric. 
             “Alliterative Meter after 1450:  The Vision of William Banastre.”
